yt_wmode.label: YouTube: WMode (undocumented)
yt_wmode.description: Undocumented parameter to set "wmode". Set to "opaque" or "transparent" Helpful for display problems as documented in the notes below.

yt_autohide.label: YouTube: Autohide
yt_autohide.description: This parameter indicates whether the video controls will automatically hide after a video begins playing. This parameter has been deprecated for HTML5 players, which display or hide the video progress bar and player controls automatically

yt_autoplay.label: YouTube: Autoplay
yt_autoplay.description: This parameter specifies whether the initial video will automatically start to play when the player loads. Supported values are 0 or 1.

yt_cc_load_policy.label: YouTube: Closed Captions
yt_cc_load_policy.description: Setting the parameters value to 1 causes closed captions to be shown by default, even if the user has turned captions off.
yt_cc_load_policy.notes: The default behavior is based on user preference.

yt_color.label: YouTube: Progressbar Color
yt_color.description: This parameter specifies the color that will be used in the players video progress bar to highlight the amount of the video that the viewer has already seen.
yt_color.notes: Valid parameter values are red and white, and, by default, the player uses the color red. Setting the color parameter to white will disable the modestbranding option.

yt_controls.label: YouTube: Display Player Controls
yt_controls.description: This parameter indicates whether the video player controls are displayed.

yt_disablekb.label: YouTube: Disable Keyboard Control
yt_disablekb.description: Setting the parameters value to 1 causes the player to respond to keyboard controls.

yt_enablejsapi.label: YouTube: Enable JS API Calls
yt_enablejsapi.description: Setting the parameters value to 1 enables the player to be controlled via IFrame or JavaScript Player API calls.
yt_enablejsapi.notes: The default value is 0, which means that the player cannot be controlled using those APIs. For more information on the IFrame API and how to use it, see the IFrame API documentation. (The JavaScript Player API has already been deprecated.)

yt_end.label: YouTube: Stop Video at ...
yt_end.description: This parameter specifies the time, measured in seconds from the start of the video, when the player should stop playing the video. The parameter value is a positive integer.
yt_end.notes: Note that the time is measured from the beginning of the video and not from either the value of the start player parameter.

yt_fs.label: YouTube: Display Fullscreen Button
yt_fs.description: Setting this parameter to 0 prevents the fullscreen button from displaying in the player.

yt_iv_load_policy.label: YouTube: Annotations Behavior
yt_iv_load_policy.description: Setting the parameters value to 1 causes video annotations to be shown by default, whereas setting to 3 causes video annotations to not be shown by default.

yt_loop.label: YouTube: Loop
yt_loop.description: In the case of a single video player, a setting of 1 causes the player to play the initial video again and again. In the case of a playlist player (or custom player), the player plays the entire playlist and then starts again at the first video.

yt_modestbranding.label: YouTube: Modestbranding
yt_modestbranding.description: This parameter lets you use a YouTube player that does not show a YouTube logo. Set the parameter value to 1 to prevent the YouTube logo from displaying in the control bar.

yt_origin.label: YouTube: Origin Domain
yt_origin.description: This parameter provides an extra security measure for the IFrame API and is only supported for IFrame embeds.
yt_origin.notes: If you are using the IFrame API, which means you are setting the enablejsapi parameter value to 1, you should always specify your domain as the origin parameter value.

yt_playsinline.label: YouTube: Plays Inline
yt_playsinline.description: This parameter controls whether videos play inline or fullscreen in an HTML5 player on iOS. Valid values are:

yt_rel.label: YouTube: Show Related Videos at the End
yt_rel.description: This parameter indicates whether the player should show related videos when playback of the initial video ends.
yt_rel.notes: Supported values are 0 and 1. The default value is 1.

yt_showinfo.label: YouTube: Show Info
yt_showinfo.description:
Supported values are 0 and 1. 
Setting the parameter's value to 0 causes the player to not display information like the video title and uploader before the video starts playing.

yt_nocookies.label: YouTube: Enable privacy-enhanced mode
yt_nocookies.description: When you turn on privacy-enhanced mode, YouTube won't store information about visitors on your website unless they play the video.
yt_nocookies.notes: Supported values are 0 and 1. The default value is 0.

yt_start.label: YouTube: Start
yt_start.description: This parameter causes the player to begin playing the video at the given number of seconds from the start of the video.

vm_autopause.label: Vimeo: Autopause
vm_autopause.description: Enables or disables pausing this video when another video is played.

vm_autoplay.label: Vimeo: Autoplay
vm_autoplay.description: Play the video automatically on load.
vm_autoplay.notes: Defaults to 0. Note that this won’t work on some devices.

vm_badge.label: Vimeo: Show Badge
vm_badge.description: Enables or disables the badge on the video.

vm_byline.label: Vimeo: Show Users byline
vm_byline.description: Show the users byline on the video.

vm_color.label: Vimeo: Player Color
vm_color.description: Specify the color of the video controls.
vm_color.notes: Defaults to 00adef. Make sure that you don’t include the #.

vm_loop.label: Vimeo: Loop
vm_loop.description: Play the video again when it reaches the end.

vm_portrait.label: Vimeo: Show User Portrait
vm_portrait.description: Show the user’s portrait on the video.

vm_title.label: Vimeo: Show Title
vm_title.description: Show the title on the video.
